section1.title: Eligibility
section1.content1: Vietnamese citizens or foreigners aged 18 and above.
section1.content2: The competition is open to both professional and amateur filmmakers.
section1.content3: Participants may enter individually or in groups (no limit on group size). In the case of group entries, one representative must be designated to communicate with the Organizing Committee (OC).

section2.content11: The submitted short film must be in MP4 or MOV format, with a minimum resolution of Full HD (1920x1080).

section2.content13: The film must be fully copyrighted by the author, with no content copied from other sources.
section2.content14: The video must be an original work, not previously submitted to any other competition, and produced within 2 years prior to submission.

section4.title: Legal Regulations
section4.content1: Participants are responsible for copyright and all related issues arising from their submitted works.
section4.content2: Participants have the right to receive support regarding information, materials, or guidance from the Organizing Committee.
section4.content3: The Organizing Committee is not responsible for any copyright or intellectual property disputes regarding the submitted works.
section4.content4: The Organizing Committee reserves the right to disqualify any work if a violation of the rules or any other legal regulations is discovered, without prior notice.
section4.content5: Submitted works must not violate Vietnamese cultural values, nor affect the honor or reputation of individuals/organizations.
section4.content6: By participating in the competition, participants agree to grant Vua Thợ full rights to use the submitted works for media activities without any additional fees. The author retains ownership of the work but cannot use it to participate in other competitions during the competition period.
section4.content7: If there are any complaints related to the competition results, participants can submit a request within 07 days after the results are announced.
section4.content8: Throughout the competition, if any unforeseen issues arise, the decision of the Organizing Committee will be final.

section8.title: Complaint Resolution
section8.content1: Individuals have the right to file complaints regarding the competition results. The complaint must include the full name, address, reason for the complaint, and be sent to the Organizing Unit. The Organizing Unit is responsible for reviewing and responding to the complaint and reporting the resolution results to the Organizing Committee. Complaints without a name, clear address, or submitted anonymously or under a false identity will not be considered.
section8.content2: The Organizing Committee will revoke prizes and notify the relevant authorities to handle the situation according to the law in the following cases:
section8.case1: The submitted work violates the Press Law, Publishing Law, Copyright Law, Intellectual Property Law, or other relevant state laws and the competition rules.
section8.case2: Using the awarded prize to engage in illegal activities.
section8.case3: The revocation of prizes will be publicly announced on mass media channels.

section1.content2: Each participant is allowed to use only one real name or one unique pseudonym when entering the competition.

section8.title: DISPUTE RESOLUTION
section8.content1: Individuals have the right to file complaints regarding the competition results. The complaint must clearly state the complainant’s full name, address, reason for the complaint, and must be submitted to the Organizing Unit. The Organizing Unit is responsible for reviewing and responding to the complaint and reporting the resolution results to the Organizing Committee. Complaints without a name, a clear address, or those submitted anonymously or under a false identity will not be considered.
section8.content2: The Organizing Committee will revoke awards and notify relevant authorities for resolution in accordance with the law in the following cases:

section8.case2: Using the awarded prize for unlawful activities.
